IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ENHANCE THE CAMPUS COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING PROFESSIONAL MANAGEMENT SERVICES, WHILE DEMONSTRATING EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE PRACTICES THROUGH DEDICATION AND COMMITMENT TO ENRICH THE STUDENT'S SOCIAL, CULTURAL, AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE AT MILLERSVILLE UNIVERSITY. SOME OF THE ORGANIZATION'S MOST SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITIES ARE MANAGEMENT OF THE STUDENT MEMORIAL CENTER, UNIVERSITY STORE, BOOK STORE, COPY SHOP, FITNESS CENTER, STUDENT BANKING, CAMPUS VENDING, TECHNICAL OPERATIONS, UNIVERSITY TICKET SALES, AND ONLINE TICKET SALES. STUDENT SERVICES, INC. WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE VARIOUS UNIVERSITY DEPARTMENTS TO PROVIDE THE SUPPORT NEEDED TO COMPLIMENT UNIVERSITY PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO ENHANCE THE CAMPUS COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING PROFESSIONAL MANAGEMENT SERVICES, WHILE DEMONSTRATING EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE PRACTICES THROUGH DEDICATION AND COMMITMENT TO ENRICH THE STUDENT'S SOCIAL, CULTURAL, AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE AT MILLERSVILLE UNIVERSITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: UNIVERSITY STORE - SALES OF TEXTBOOKS, EDUCATIONAL SUPPLIES, CLOTHING, AND MEMORABILIA.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: TECHNICAL OPERATIONS - OPERATION OF LIGHTING AND SOUND SYSTEMS FOR ACTIVITIES OF THE UNIVERSITY

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: LAUNDRY AND VENDING MACHINE - CAMPUS LAUNDRY, VENDING, ETC.
TICKET SALES, FITNESS CENTER, GAME ROOM, OTHER MISCELLANEOUS PROGRAMS
DONATIONS AND GRANTS TO THE GENERAL FUND OF MILLERSVILLE UNIVERSITY, STIPENDS FOR STUDENT ORGANIZATION LEADERS, AND CASH DONATIONS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.
COPY SHOP - OPERATION OF A PRINTING AND COPY SHOP

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 12, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: MISCELLANEOUS INCOME - 2014 AMOUNT: $ 3,843. 2015 AMOUNT: $ 2,823. 2016 AMOUNT: $ 59,018. 2017 AMOUNT: $ 211.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE CORPORATION, INCLUDING WHETHER THE ENTITY IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT EVALUATED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN AND CONCLUDED THAT THE CORPORATION HAD TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THEREFORE, NO PROVISION OR LIABILITY FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN INCLUDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. WITH FEW EXCEPTIONS, THE CORPORATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY THE U.S. FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2015.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 1,606,157. RENTAL EXPENSES 15,967,208.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM AND REVIEWED BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER OF THE ORGANIZATION BEFORE IT IS FILED. ANY DISCREPANCIES ARE REPORTED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE. A COPY OF THE 990 IS ALSO EMAILED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REGULARLY REVIEWED BY HUMAN RESOURCES AND THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RECOMMENDATIONS FOR COMPENSATION OF TOP MANAGEMENT AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE SUBMITTED TO THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE. THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE ENDORSEMENT IS THEN PRESENTED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST TO THE ORGANIZATION.
PENSION RELATED CHANGES OTHER THAN NET PERIODIC PENSION COSTS 2,023,589.
THE FINANCE COMMITTEE HAS TAKEN RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE OVERSIGHT AND REVIEW OF THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDIT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
